articles.author: Sebastian Kettley
articles.title: Life after death: Bill Nye says 'overwhelming evidence' proves there is no afterlife - Daily Express
articles.description: LIFE after death does not exist, at least according to science communicator Bill Nye the Science Guy who thinks there is 'overwhelming evidence' against the conventional idea of an afterlife.

articles.author: Michelle Starr
articles.title: 'Restless' Supermassive Black Hole Found Mysteriously Wandering in Space - ScienceAlert
articles.description: We tend to think of supermassive black holes as relatively stationary things - sitting there bang in the middle of a galaxy while everything else swirls around it.
articles.content:
We tend to think of supermassive black holes as relatively stationary things - sitting there bang in the middle of a galaxy while everything else swirls around it.

articles.author: Matt Williams, Universe Today
articles.title: Scientists Reveal How Many Interstellar Objects May Be Visiting Our Solar System - ScienceAlert
articles.description: In October 19th, 2017, the first interstellar object ever detected flew past Earth on its way out of the Solar System. Less than two years later, a second object was detected, an easily-identified interstellar comet designated as 2I/Borisov.
articles.content: In October 19th, 2017, the first interstellar object ever detected flew past Earth on its way out of the Solar System. Less than two years later, a second object was detected, an easily-identified in… [+7715 chars]

articles.author: Rory Tingle
articles.title: 'Fly my pretties, fly': Elon Musk hails the launch of another 60 Starlink satellites - Daily Mail
articles.description: Video showed a Falcon 9 rocket taking off at 6.01am Sunday from the Kennedy Space Center, with the satellites located in its nose cone, prompting Musk to tweet, 'Fly my pretties, fly.'
articles.content:
Elon Musk has launched another 60 Starlink satellites into the Earth's orbit as part of his plan to create a new global superfast Internet system.

articles.author: Mike Wehner
articles.title: Uh oh, the Hubble is acting weird - BGR
articles.description: The Hubble Space Telescope is old. It’s rapidly approaching its 31st anniversary of being launched on its mission to study the cosmos, and while 31 years might not seem like that long, for a piece of machinery orbiting Earth — and enduring all that comes with…
